metadata.title: QuickStack | Your trusted technology partner
metadata.description: Transform your ideas into professional digital solutions. Fast, transparent development for startups, entrepreneurs and small businesses ready to grow their online presence.

hero.description: We don’t just write code; we build the engine for your next big leap. Leave technical frustration behind and start selling with a solid, professional product.

services.title: Let’s Grow Together
services.subtitle: Solutions designed for the budget and speed your stage needs

landing.name: Pro Landing
landing.ideal: Businesses that need a professional digital presence

mvp.name: MVP Starter
mvp.ideal: Founders who need to validate with real users

techStack.title: Modern and Proven Technology
techStack.subtitle: Tools that guarantee quality and speed

mossbros.description: Complete web management system for a motorcycle repair shop. Digitized all operational processes, eliminating paper records.

authenticdoc.description: Decentralized PWA for digital signatures using the Nostr protocol. Provides full control over documents and identity through zero-knowledge architecture.

rtp.description: Professional website for postpartum doula services. Educates families and makes it easier to connect with specialized care services.
rtp.result: Professional digital presence • Instant load • Mobile-first

step1.title: Virtual Strategy Coffee
step1.description: It’s not just a sales call. We analyze whether your idea is viable and how we can make it a reality in the most efficient way.

step2.title: Proposal
step2.description: Detailed plan, scope, timeline, and exact budget.

step3.title: Development
step3.description: Daily updates via Slack. We act as your internal tech team, but without hiring costs.

step4.title: Delivery & Adjustments
step4.description: We refine details until everything is perfect.

step5.title: Support
step5.description: Bug fixes and technical questions at no additional cost.

q1.question: How long does a typical project take?
q1.answer: Most MVPs are completed in 2–3 weeks. Landing pages are ready in 1 week. Custom projects may take 3–6 weeks depending on complexity. During our initial call we will provide you with an exact timeline.

q2.question: Do you include UI/UX design?
q2.answer: Yes, all packages include professional UI/UX design. We work with a mobile-first approach and clean design. If you already have a design, we can implement it directly.

q3.question: What happens after delivery?
q3.answer: All projects include 1 week of post-delivery adjustments and 30 days of technical support for bugs. After that period, we offer monthly maintenance plans or you can contact us for specific improvements.

q4.question: Do you work with clients outside El Salvador?
q4.answer: Absolutely. We work with clients across Latin America, the United States, and Europe. Communication is via Slack, email, and video calls. Time zones are not a problem — we adapt to your schedule.

q5.question: Do you offer ongoing maintenance?
q5.answer: Yes, we offer monthly maintenance plans that include security updates, monitoring, small improvements, and priority support. Prices vary by project, generally between $100–$300/month.

q6.question: What is your payment policy?
q6.answer: We usually work with 50% upfront and 50% on delivery. For larger projects, we can split payments into more milestones. We accept bank transfers, PayPal, and cryptocurrencies. Everything is documented in a simple contract.

cta.description: Don’t let technology be the brake on your business. Let’s talk and design the fastest path to your success.

metadata.title: Terms of Service | QuickStack
metadata.description: Terms and conditions for QuickStack software development services

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.content: By engaging QuickStack's services, you accept these terms and conditions in their entirety. If you disagree with any part of these terms, you may not use our services.

section2.title: 2. Description of Services
section2.content: QuickStack offers software development services including, but not limited to:

section3.title: 3. Work Process
section3.content: Each project begins with a discovery call to understand your needs. Subsequently, a detailed proposal is presented with scope, timeline, and budget. Work begins once the proposal is approved and the agreed initial payment is received.

section4.title: 4. Payments and Billing
section4.content: Payment terms are established in each individual proposal. Generally:
items: Payments are processed via bank transfer or agreed payment platforms

section5.title: 5. Intellectual Property
section5.content: Once full payment is completed, the client receives all rights to the source code and digital assets developed specifically for their project. QuickStack retains the right to use tools, libraries, and generic components developed internally in other projects.

section6.title: 6. Revisions and Changes
section6.content: Each package includes a specific number of revision rounds detailed in the proposal. Significant changes to the project scope may require adjustments to the budget and timeline, which will be communicated and approved before proceeding.

section7.title: 7. Confidentiality
section7.content: QuickStack commits to maintaining the confidentiality of all information shared during the project. We will not share sensitive business information with third parties without your express consent.

section8.title: 8. Warranty and Support
section8.content: We offer a 30-day warranty period after delivery for bug fixes related to the delivered work. Additional support and ongoing maintenance can be contracted separately.

section9.title: 9. Limitation of Liability
section9.content: QuickStack will not be liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages that may arise from the use of the developed software. Our maximum liability is limited to the total amount paid for the project.

section10.title: 10. Cancellation
section10.content: The client may cancel the project at any time. In case of cancellation, work completed to date will be invoiced. Advance payments are non-refundable once development has started.

section11.title: 11. Contact
section11.content: For any questions about these terms, you can contact us at

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | QuickStack
metadata.description: Privacy policy and data protection information for QuickStack

section1.title: 1. Information We Collect
section1.content: We collect information you provide directly to us, including:
items: Communications we exchange during the project

section2.title: 2. Use of Information
section2.content: We use the collected information to:
items: Provide and improve our development services
Respond to your inquiries and support requests
Send relevant updates about our services (with your consent)

section3.title: 3. Sharing Information
section3.content: We do not sell or share your personal information with third parties, except in the following cases:
items: Service providers necessary for the project (hosting, payments) under confidentiality agreements
When required by law or legal process

section4.title: 4. Data Security
section4.content: We implement technical and organizational security measures to protect your information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. This includes encryption of sensitive data, restricted access to project information, and secure development practices.

section5.title: 5. Data Retention
section5.content: We retain your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this policy, including legal and tax obligations. Project data is maintained during the business relationship and for a reasonable period thereafter for support and reference.

section6.title: 6. Your Rights
items: Access the personal information we have about you
Request deletion of your data (subject to legal obligations)
Object to processing of your data for marketing

section7.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section7.content: Our website may use cookies and similar technologies to improve user experience and analyze site traffic. You can configure your browser to reject cookies, although this may affect some functionalities.

section8.title: 8. Third-Party Sites
section8.content: Our site may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these sites and recommend reviewing their respective privacy policies.

section9.title: 9. Changes to This Policy
section9.content: We may update this privacy policy occasionally. We will notify you of significant changes by posting the new policy on our website with the corresponding update date.

section10.title: 10. Contact
section10.content: If you have questions about this privacy policy or how we handle your data, contact us at
